text:
e="preserve">Leo Tateusz Sugar (April 6, 1929 – September 2020) was an American professional football player. He was a defensive end in the National Football League (NFL) for the Chicago Cardinals/St. Louis Cardinals, Philadelphia Eagles, and the Detroit Lions. He went to two Pro Bowls during his nine-year career.
Sugar played college football at Purdue University. He was born in Flint, Michigan.
Sugar died in Fort Myers, Florida in September 2020 at the age of 91.
